summary: The American Teacher Act aims to address teacher shortages and improve teacher compensation. The bill proposes providing grants to state educational agencies to increase teacher salaries, setting a minimum annual salary of $60,000 (adjusted for inflation) for full-time teachers at qualifying schools. It also includes provisions for cost-of-living adjustments, promotes awareness of the teaching profession, and defines key terms. The bill seeks to support states' efforts in ensuring competitive wages and addressing the teacher wage penalty.
